description: Learn the fundamentals of writing and executing Python code

questions.question: Fill in the blank to print "Hello, World!" in Python.
questions.explanation: In Python, we use print() function with text in quotes to display output.
hints: Remember to use quotes around text

questions.question: Which of the following will print Hello, World! in Python?
questions.explanation: print() is the correct Python function for displaying output.
hints: Other options are from different languages

questions.question: In Python, the print() function can be used to display text on the screen.
questions.explanation: print() is indeed used to display text output in Python.
hints: Think about how we show text in Python
This is a fundamental Python concept

questions.question: What is wrong with this Python code?
options: The string is not enclosed in quotes
The print function needs to be lowercase
questions.explanation: String literals in Python must be enclosed in quotes.
hints: Look at how the text is written
Python needs to know what's text and what's code

flashcards.front: What is the purpose of print() function?
flashcards.back: The print() function outputs text to the console.

flashcards.front: What is the correct syntax for printing text?
flashcards.back: print("Your text here") - using parentheses and quotes

flashcards.front: Why are quotes important in print statements?
flashcards.back: Quotes tell Python that the content is a text string, not code
